td.a: EMK Gives Back - It's The Right Thing to Do!

img.br: With dire predictions of shortages of personal protective equiment for health care workers, Dr. Walker Gregory reached out to our partners at Brigham and Women's Hospital and Massachusetts General Hospital to donate all the masks, gloves, and gowns in the Health Assisting program stockroom. "It is the right thing to do - one small way we can support the hospitals who give so much to prepare our students for their health professions futures," she said.

td.a: Special Education Parent Advisory Council EMK Parent Orientation
Welcome Back EMK Families - Join us for Back to School Night

img.br: EMK invites all families to join us on Thursday, September 12th from 4-7pm at Back to School Night. Meet your child's teachers, learn about their courses, and receive valuable information about the academic expectations for the year.

td.a: BBBS and EMK bring good luck to the Red Sox!

img.br: Yesterday, Big Brother Big Sister had the opportunity to take 15 Sophomore students to the Red Sox game at Fenway Park. Not only did our student have an awesome time at the game, but the Red Sox won! Check out some of the pictures from the game and we want to give a huge shout out to BBBS for this opportunity!

Students at the Edward M. Kennedy Academy for Health Careers are working on a project to explore issues in their communities and envision solutions. They are studying the teachings of Martin Luther King Jr. and Cesar Chavez and applying the public narrative framework developed by Marshall Ganz, a visionary grassroots organizer, to investigate issues that are important to them.
The project kicked off in November with an invigorating panel comprising Boston changemakers and leaders. As part of their research on effecting change, the emerging activists spent the morning at the Massachusetts State House. They met with Senator Sonia Chang-Díaz, learned about how bills become laws, and presented advocacy letters to their state representatives.
Read more about the article at this link: https://medium.com/@826Boston/how-boston-high-school-students-are-changing-the-world-today-f142197858eb?mc_cid=231d19146b&mc_eid=4960c1690a

td.a: EMK Senior gets published in SPINE!

img.br: Louckens Joseph, 12th grader at EMK, is apart of the EmersonWRITES - A free Emerson College writing experience for High School students. Recently, Louckens was published in EmersonWRITES annual publication called "SPINE." In Volume 9 of this publication, you will find Louckens poem entitled "Time Constraint." During these college-based workshops, students like Louckens learn how to build writing skills and express yourself through creative writing. We are super proud of him!
